resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.

A cappuccino is an Italian coffee drink traditionally made with equal parts of espresso, steamed milk, and a thick layer of frothed milk foam. It is distinct from other espresso-based drinks like a latte due to this specific 1:1:1 ratio, which gives it a strong coffee flavor and a creamy, airy texture.
A mocha is a coffee drink that combines the rich flavor of espresso with the sweetness of chocolate and the creaminess of steamed milk. It is essentially a chocolate-flavored variant of a latte
